chargeHist.descr: Manuf'r Falsely Present NonDrug as Drug

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A Bloedow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf'r Falsely Present NonDrug as Drug, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 15CF87 and any other sentences.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE to comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent.
DE to provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A Bloedow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated undecided at this time about seeking PCR.

Defendant Jason A Bloedow in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Defendant Jason A Bloedow in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM95.  State recites agreements into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnarie/waiver of rights.  State moves to amend 15CF87 to 961.41(3g)(g), DE will enter a plea of NC.  15CM95 state moves to dismiss repeater, DE will enter a plea of NC.

15CF87-Withhold sentence, 3 years probation, concurrent to any other sentence DE is serving, $100.00 restitution to R.C.S.D, CC, DNA sample/surcharge/comply with all programming recommended by the DOC agent.

15CM95-withhold sentence, 1 year probation, CC, DOC programming.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Court accepts the plea's finds the DE guilty.

Defendant Jason A Bloedow in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Defendant Jason A Bloedow in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM95.  Hearing via video conference from Sawyer County.  Set for plea 11-20-15 @ 2:00PM  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Dated 9/30/15 from Atty Bryce Schoenborn to Drug Court coordinator.  Filed in all cases as no court case number applied to letter.  (letter filed in 15CF87)

Defendant Jason A Bloedow in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Defendant Jason A Bloedow in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM95.  State calls Investigator Steve Gronski, oath given.  Direct by the State. Cross by Defense.  Redirect by the State.  Witness dismissed.  State rests, asks for bind over.  Court finds probable cause exists, will bind over for trail court, Information filed this day by the State.  Will proceed to arraignment, waive reading of information, enter a plea of NG.  Set for RH via video conference for Judge Yackel 10-26-15 @ 8:45AM.  Track 15CM95 along.
Plea of Not guilty and demand for twelve person jury trial

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason A Bloedow in court with attorney Matthew James Krische.  Defendant Jason A Bloedow in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF87.    Waive reading of the CC,  court will enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts in 15CM95.  Waive reading of CC in 15CF87.  DE/Atty will waive time limits for PH.  Court instructs on waiver, will accept waiver.  Court is recusing himself from these two cases as DE is enrolled in Rusk County Drug Court.
